title: 108_hr2239
content: The Act titled "Voter Confidence and Increased Accessibility Act of 2003" extends the time for states to request payments under Title I. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 is amended to change deadlines for payments related to election administration and voting machine replacement. Additionally, the authorization of appropriations is extended for fiscal years 2003 and 2004. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 is amended to change deadlines for payments related to election administration and voting machine replacement. An aggregate amount of $650,000,000 is authorized for fiscal years 2003 and 2004. Amendments include a new date for transferring unobligated funds and a requirement for states to deploy an interim paper system if a waiver is requested. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 is amended by repealing the exemption of the Election Assistance Commission from certain government contracting requirements. This amendment will apply to contracts entered into by the Commission after the enactment of this Act. Additionally, there is a new provision promoting accuracy, integrity, and security through a voter-verified permanent record or hard copy. The Help America Vote Act of 2002 is amended to require voting systems to produce a voter-verified paper record for manual audit, ensuring accuracy and security in elections. The voting system must provide a voter-verified paper record for manual audit and correction of errors before the record is preserved. This paper record will be the official record used for any recount in elections where the system is used. The voting system must disclose source code of software used, prohibit wireless communication devices, and certify software and hardware through accredited laboratories. The voting system must provide voter-verification of results for individuals with disabilities, separating vote generation from casting similar to paper ballot verification, without requiring the use of paper. The voting system must meet disability access and voter-verification standards outlined in the paragraph, with a deadline set in section 5(a). If an interim paper system is deployed under section 5(b), disabled voters can use it with an aide or the voting system in place for disabled voters according to the Help America Vote Act of 2002. The Election Assistance Commission must study, test, and develop best practices to improve accessibility and voter-verification for disabled voters under the Help America Vote Act of 2002. SEC. 5. CHANGE IN DEADLINE FOR COMPLIANCE WITH STANDARDS. Amends the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to change the deadline for compliance with voting system standards to be in time for elections for Federal office beginning with the general election in November 2004. States unable to comply by that time will receive a paper voting system for the November 2004 elections. SEC. 6 amends the Help America Vote Act to require federal certification of technological security for voter registration lists. SEC. 7 mandates mandatory recounts. SEC. 7 mandates manual surprise recounts of voter-verified records for Federal, State, and local elections in a small percentage of jurisdictions following each general election. Results will be published, and appeals can be filed if the law is believed to be unfair. The amendments made by this Act will take effect as if included in the enactment of the Help America Vote Act of 2002, except as provided in section 3(b).
